ADTF_STREAMINGConfig.cmake
1 #######################################################################
2 #
3 # ADTF StreamingLib cmake config file
4 #
5 # &copy; Audi Electronics Venture GmbH. All rights reserved.
6 #
7 #######################################################################
8 
9 ## \page page_cmake_overview ADTF CMake Build System
10 # \li For an introduction into the ADTF CMake build system please have a look at
11 # \subpage page_cmake_basics.
12 # \li For instructions on how to build the ADTF StreamingLib examples please
13 # have a look at \subpage page_cmake_examples.
14 #
15 # \page page_cmake_examples Using CMake to build the ADTF StreamingLib Examples
16 # ADTF StreamingLib ships CMake build files and configurations that require at
17 # least <b>CMake Version 2.8.4</b>.
18 #
19 # Only the <b>Debug</b> and the <b>RelWithDebInfo</b> configurations are
20 # supported by ADTF StreamingLib.
21 #
22 # \section Sec1 Building the examples
23 #
24 # Note that if you paste some paths from the clipboard into cmake gui, make sure that you
25 # replace all backslashes with <b>forward slashes</b> (paste it, then press "..." and ok)!
26 #
27 # -# Launch cmake-gui
28 # -# Set the source directory to the installation directory of ADTF StreamingLib
29 # (e.g C:/Tools/adtf-streaminglib).
30 # -# Set the build/binary directory to a NEW and different directory (e.g.
31 # C:/Work/streaminglib-build)
32 # -# Press configure.
33 # -# Click 'yes' when cmake asks to create the build directory.
34 # -# Select your compiler in the dialog that appears now and press 'Finish'.
35 # -# You will now get red values in the list, red does not mean wrong but new!
36 # -# Press Configure again.
37 # -# Set CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX to the installation directory of ADTF StreamingLib
38 # (e.g C:/Tools/adtf-streaminglib).
39 # You can choose any directory you like.
40 # -# Press Configure again.
41 # -# You should now have everything ready and no red values.
42 # -# On Linux make sure that you set CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE to either "Debug" or
43 # "RelWithDebInfo" and if you get an empty ADTF_FONTCONFIG_LIBRARY please
44 # install the fontconfig development package of your linux distribution.
45 # -# Press Generate.
46 # -# Now go to the build directory:
47 # - On Windows open the adtf_streaminglib_examples solution with
48 # Visual Studio and build it. Don't forget to build the INSTALL project
49 # after everything has been built.
50 # - On Linux type 'make install' in the build directory.
51 # -# done
52 #
53 # \page page_cmake_basics ADTF CMake Introduction
54 # \section sec1 What is CMake?
55 # CMake is a meta build system that lets you generate native build environments
56 # for multiple platforms and compilers with a single configuration. For example,
57 # it enables you generate Visual Studio solutions on Windows and Unix Makefile
58 # projects on Linux using gcc. This page is intended for introductionary use
59 # only. For a complete CMake documentation please visit http://www.cmake.org.
60 #
61 # \section sec2 Getting CMake
62 # ADTF StreamingLib requires at least <b>CMake Version 2.8.4</b>.
63 # \li <b>Windows:</b> Head over to
64 # http://www.cmake.org/cmake/resources/software.html and download the current
65 # version there.
66 # \li <b>Linux:</b> If your distribution provides packages for cmake >= 2.8.4
67 # just install these packages and your good to go.
68 # Otherwise head over to http://www.cmake.org/cmake/resources/software.html and
69 # download the binaries for Linux. Note that the i386 binaries work just fine on
70 # a 64Bit Linux system. After you have extracted the binaries make sure to put
71 # the contained 'bin' directory in your PATH variable.
72 #
73 # \section sec3 Basic Concepts
74 # Each CMake project has a CMakeLists.txt file at the root of its directory
75 # hierarchy. This file defines the project and contains the necessary
76 # instructions to build it. For example CMakeLists.txt files see section
77 # \ref secCMakeExamples. CMake supports both so called out-of-source builds and
78 # in-source builds. We discourage the use of the latter since it will clutter
79 # your source directory with multiple files. So building a CMake project
80 # typically involves three directories:
81 # -# The source directory: this is the directory where the CMakeLists.txt and
82 # all other source files (i.e. .cpp and .h files) reside.
83 # -# The build directory: this is where the native build system and intermediate
84 # build artifacts will be put.
85 # -# The installation directory: this is the directory where everything that
86 # makes up the final product will be placed.
87 #
88 # Building a CMake project requires the following steps to be carried out:
89 # -# Creating a native build system using cmake (most likely with cmake-gui)
90 # -# Building with the native build system, i.e Visual Studio or Make.
91 #
92 # \section sec4 Creating a Native Build System
93 #
94 # To create a native build system launch cmake-gui and follow these steps:
95 # -# Enter the source directory on top of the gui.
96 # -# Enter the build directory, choose a new and empty directory.
97 # -# Press Configure.
98 # -# CMake will ask what kind of a project you want to generate, choose the one
99 # to your liking.
100 # -# CMake will now try to find all required external dependencies and will
101 # present a list of variables.
102 # -# Please keep in mind that variables marked red are not necessarily errors
103 # but just new.
104 # -# Now fill those variables and press configure and repeat these steps until
105 # the Generate button gets active.
106 # -# While doing so keep an eye on the log window in the lower part of the
107 # cmake-gui that will provide hints on how to resolve problems that might
108 # occur.
109 # -# On Linux make sure that you set CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE to either "Debug" or
110 # "RelWithDebInfo".
111 # -# Hovering over a variable will bring up a descriptive tooltip.
112 # -# Press Generate.
113 #
114 # \section Building
115 # - Visual Studio: Just open the generated solution file (in the build
116 # directory) and build it.
117 # \note Build the INSTALL target to copy all files to their correct locations
118 # in the installation directory.
119 # - Linux/Make: Enter the build directory and run 'make install'.
120 #
121 # \section secCMakeExamples CMakeLists.txt Examples
122 #
123 # \subsection sub4 ADTF Executable
124 # \code
125 # # This is required by CMake
126 # cmake_minimum_required(VERSION 2.8.4 FATAL_ERROR)
127 # # Say that we want to use ADTF Streaming Library
128 # find_package(ADTF_STREAMING 2.9.0 REQUIRED)
129 # # Give our project a name
130 # project(adtf_executable_example)
131 # # Specify the executable target
132 # add_executable(demo_exe
133 # stdafx.h
134 # stdafx.cpp
135 # demo_exe.h
136 # demo_exe.cpp
137 # )
138 # # Link the executable against ADTF Streaming Library
139 # target_link_libraries(demo_exe
140 # ${ADTF_STREAMING_LIB}
141 # )
142 # # Specify where it should be installed to
143 # install(TARGETS demo_exe
144 # DESTINATION bin
145 # )
146 # \endcode
147 #
148 #######################################################################
149 
150 # execute only once
151 if (ADTF_STREAMING_FOUND)
152  return()
153 endif(ADTF_STREAMING_FOUND)
154 
155 cmake_minimum_required(VERSION 2.8.4 FATAL_ERROR)
156 
157 cmake_policy(SET CMP0011 NEW)
158 
159 include_directories(${ADTF_STREAMING_DIR}/include)
160 link_directories(${ADTF_STREAMING_DIR}/lib)
161 
162 set (ADTF_STREAMING_LIB_VERSION ${ADTF_STREAMING_VERSION_MAJOR}${ADTF_STREAMING_VERSION_MINOR}${ADTF_STREAMING_VERSION_PATCH})
163 
164 if (NOT ADTF_STREAMING_LIB)
165  set (ADTF_STREAMING_LIB adtfstreaming)
166 endif (NOT ADTF_STREAMING_LIB)
167 if (NOT ADTF_BUILD_STREAMING)
168  if (WIN32)
169  add_library(${ADTF_STREAMING_LIB} STATIC IMPORTED)
170  set_target_properties(${ADTF_STREAMING_LIB} PROPERTIES
171  IMPORTED_LOCATION_DEBUG ${ADTF_STREAMING_DIR}/lib/${ADTF_STREAMING_LIB}D_${ADTF_STREAMING_LIB_VERSION}.lib
172  IMPORTED_LOCATION_RELWITHDEBINFO ${ADTF_STREAMING_DIR}/lib/${ADTF_STREAMING_LIB}_${ADTF_STREAMING_LIB_VERSION}.lib
173  IMPORTED_LOCATION_RELEASE ${ADTF_STREAMING_DIR}/lib/${ADTF_STREAMING_LIB}_${ADTF_STREAMING_LIB_VERSION}.lib
174  )
175  else (WIN32)
176  add_library(${ADTF_STREAMING_LIB} SHARED IMPORTED)
177  set_target_properties(${ADTF_STREAMING_LIB} PROPERTIES
178  IMPORTED_LOCATION_DEBUG ${ADTF_STREAMING_DIR}/lib/lib${ADTF_STREAMING_LIB}D_${ADTF_STREAMING_LIB_VERSION}.so
179  IMPORTED_LOCATION_RELWITHDEBINFO ${ADTF_STREAMING_DIR}/lib/lib${ADTF_STREAMING_LIB}_${ADTF_STREAMING_LIB_VERSION}.so
180  IMPORTED_LOCATION_RELEASE ${ADTF_STREAMING_DIR}/lib/lib${ADTF_STREAMING_LIB}_${ADTF_STREAMING_LIB_VERSION}.so
181  )
182  endif(WIN32)
183 endif (NOT ADTF_BUILD_STREAMING)
